s.text: The progressives preferred government by experts to mob rule; Perot claimed that "smart people" in Washington already had the plans, all that was lacking was the will to implement them.
The progressives preferred government by experts to mob rule; Perot claimed that "smart people" in Washington already had the plans, all that was lacking was the will to implement them.
The progressives preferred government by experts to mob rule; Perot claimed that "smart people" in Washington already had the plans, all that was lacking was the will to implement them.

Perot and his Concord Coalition allies, the New Englanders Paul Tsongas and Warren Rudman, were as horrified by the federal deficit as the Mugwumps had been appalled by the support of Bryanite populists for bimetallism and as the Liberal Republicans, a generation earlier in the Gilded Age, had been frightened by paper money.

Jesse Ventura is the product of Minnesota political culture, with its mix of Yankee and Germanic reformism and its long history of influential regional third-party movements such as the Nonpartisan League and the Farmer-Labor party.

Populism has more often found a home in the Highland South than in the coastal "black belt," which has been dominated since colonial times by the elitist conservatism of ruling-class Bourbon families and their allies.
The puritan crusaders of the North and the alienated populists of the South may share common political enemies, but little else.
